lists-question4_key1: A `palindrome` is a word, sentence, verse, or even a number that reads the same backward or forward. Like NITIN. Read Nitin either from left or right, it will be same. Similarly MOM is also a `palindrome`.
lists-question4_key2: Write a `code` that checks whether a list is a palindrome or not. And print “Haan! palindrome hai” if its a `pallindrome` and “nahi! palindrome nahi hai” if its not a palindrome.
lists-question4_key3: For the time being you can use the list given below for writing the `code`.
lists-question4_key4: Now, change your list, and test it with different values and then finally `upload` the correct `code`.
lists-question4_key5: You can test for these values.
lists-question4_key8: When the `index is i`, then what will be at index `length - i -1`.
